Thanks! Could you please add a test? I realize that testing this using a TestPipeline is problematic because it's not clear how to test unbounded sources that don't report termination (will get much easier with SDF...), but I believe you should be able to explicitly create an UnboundedJmsSource/Reader in a unit test, and write a test that like checkpoints them and resumes from the checkpoint and verifies that messages get redelivered.

Coverage increased (+0.003%) to 70.2% when pulling **8b20981ab5ca3ef2c0d2d58736d1d188af491152 on hepeknet:BEAM-2258** into **d6ac39a23e50e82c013e5052b48cb6ffbf929195 on apache:master**.

For the `unbounded` source question, `Top` not only support `GlobalWindow` but also other window strategy[1].

For the `Window` operator, you mean [2] right? To be honest I don't know SQL support such syntax before :( , after some reading I think `ORDER BY` has little to do with `Window`?

suppose we have the following SQL:

```sql
select id, name, count(id) over x 
from person 
window x as (PARTITION BY id) 
order by id desc, name asc nulls first 
limit 1 offset 1
```

the corresponding relational algebra tree is:

```bash
LogicalSort(sort0=[$0], sort1=[$1], dir0=[DESC], dir1=[ASC-nulls-first], offset=[1], fetch=[1])
  LogicalProject(id=[$0], name=[$1], EXPR$2=[COUNT($0) OVER (PARTITION BY $0 RANGE BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND UNBOUNDED FOLLOWING)])
    EnumerableTableScan(table=[[person]])
```

The window functions(the `EXPR$2` above) is executed as part of the `LogicProject`, after that the LogicalSort(`ORDER BY LIMIT`) will be executed. i.e. `LogicalSort` take the whole `LogicalSort` as input, regardless of whether the `LogiccalProject` contains a window functions or not.

[1].https://github.com/xumingming/beam/blob/7e04924ee7b31e28326f761618173749a55789d0/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/Top.java#L87-L87
[2].https://github.com/apache/calcite/blob/aed5bca7c5f49d117d7b794395ff4b6ad2d76bde/core/src/main/java/org/apache/calcite/rel/core/Window.java#L65-L65

Ooh, nice catch. Unfortunately, this is not the right fix -- HadoopResourceId is not implemented correctly. (The entire point of not using URI is that URI is unusably terrible in what it does, and we want normalized, consistent paths with obvious behavior.)

Of course the real issue is that the designer of FileSystems APIs did not provide any documented semantics or a test suite. I'll work on that now.

R: @jkff -@dhalperi

Please ensure the result is backwards-compatible with 2.0.0

But a URI is able to have /, //, and /// and they all mean different things. (not all different since /// and / are the same.)

If we do treat this as a URI, then filesystems.py is also incorrect.

Hi Aljoscha. The thing is that current Nexmark branch is based on beam 2.10 and your PR branch is based on 0.7.0-SNAPSHOT. So here is what I did: 
1. I checked out your PR branch.
2. I renamed the version in the flink runner module to 0.7.0-SNAPSHOT-aljoscha
3. `mvn clean install` in flink runner module
4. I went backward in history of nexmark branch before refactoring to beam 2.10
5. I put 0.7.0-SNAPSHOT-aljoscha version in flink runner dependency of nexmark
6. I pushed a branch for you at  echauchot/BEAM-160-nexmark-BEAM-593

So you need to do steps 1,2,3 checkout my branch above and then run 
`mvn exec:java -Dexec.mainClass=org.apache.beam.integration.nexmark.Main -Pflink-runner "-Dexec.args=--runner=FlinkRunner --query=0 --streamTimeout=10 --streaming=true --manageResources=false --monitorJobs=true  --flinkMaster=local"`
from directory `beam/integration/java/nexmark`
R: @jbonofre

After speaking with Dan in person, it turns out that other parts of our codebase use string based equality and sorting instead of URI based equality and sorting and thus would break if /// was changed to / since it would change sort orders and equality checks in other parts of the code base. This will require making HadoopResourceId and all other ResourceIds stricter until the internals are migrated to using URIs.
Against wrong branch
Thanks for willing to take on extra work. This PR will go to master, and would not affect Beam's first stable release.
